definition: whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)

sentences.english: Don't play with the pointer when not using it.
sentences.chinese: 当你不使用教鞭时，不要舞弄它。

sentences.english: Mr. Smith rapped on the board with his pointer to call the class to order.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生用教鞭敲着黑板要求全班安静。

sentences.english: Lippi was brought from Napoli to Turin to aid in the turn around.
sentences.chinese: 里皮应邀从那波利来到都灵执掌教鞭。

sentences.english: Warren had been talking along very solemnly, flourishing his pointer.
sentences.chinese: 华伦一直很严肃地讲着，挥动着手里的教鞭。

sentences.english: The same as what happened when I was given the job all those years ago.
sentences.chinese: 二十几年前我接过利物浦教鞭的时候也是这样的情况。

sentences.english: The admiral giving the briefing took his pointer.
sentences.chinese: 正在作情况介绍的海军上将拿起他的教鞭。

sentences.english: After having worked three years as a translator, he took up teaching again.
sentences.chinese: 做了三年的翻译工作以后，他又重新执起教鞭。

sentences.english: Take the pointer, point at different things and say what they are.
sentences.chinese: 拿着教鞭，指不同的东西，说出他们的名称。

sentences.english: A married woman returning to teaching needs to furbish up her old skills.
sentences.chinese: 重新拿起教鞭的已婚妇女需要重温过去的教书技能。

sentences.english: Day after day the teacher would cane him unmercifully.
sentences.chinese: 每天老师都会用教鞭无情的敲打他。

sentences.english: When place defile pointer, soul has changed.
sentences.chinese: 当铜臭感染教鞭，灵魂变了。

sentences.english: Before I came to CTTB, I had been teaching for 17 years in Malaysia.
sentences.chinese: 在这之前，我在马来西亚也执了十七年的教鞭。

sentences.english: Villa's manager, Alex McLeish, knew when he took the job that Young would be leaving.
sentences.chinese: 维拉经理麦克利什接过教鞭之后就只会杨会离开。

sentences.english: Let us not shrink from a hard lesson or wince under any rod of chastisement.
sentences.chinese: 让我们不要畏缩难学的功课，和逃避教鞭的惩罚了。

sentences.english: After the translation having made 3 years works, he holds up a pointer again.
sentences.chinese: 做了三年的翻译工作后，他又重新执起教鞭。

definition: to teach/to be a teacher/to train/to coach
sporting coach/military drill master (in Song times)
to finish class/to get out of class
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
foreign teacher (abbr. for 外國教師|外国教师)/greenhorn/novice/amateurish/religion other than Buddhism (term used by Buddhists)
to be in command/(fig.) to dominate over other considerations/to be given overemphasis
to leave office/to leave one's post
